Package bignumber

Interface BigNumber

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<BigNumber>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BigNumberImpl
    public interface BigNumber
extends java.lang.Comparable<BigNumber>
    This interface represents the List of numbers which is a very big Number. It defines a few operations on BigNumbers, specifically with the following method signatures.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      BigNumber add​(BigNumber other)
      A functionality to add two BigNumbers and returns the sum of these two numbers.
      void addDigit​(int digit)
      This method takes a single digit as an argument and adds it to this bigNumber.
      BigNumber copy()
      A functionality to get clone the given bingNumber.
      int getDigitAt​(int index)
      This method that takes a position as an argument and returns the digit at that position from bigNumberList.
      int length()
      A functionality to get the length of this numberList.
      void shiftLeft​(int numOfShifts)
      This method takes the number of shifts as an argument and shifts this number to the left by that number, which is simply multiplying this bigNumber by 10.
      void shiftRight​(int numOfShifts)
      This method takes the number of shifts as an argument and shifts this number to the right by that number, which is Simply dividing this bigNumber by 2.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • length

        int length()
        A functionality to get the length of this numberList.
        Returns:
        returns the number of digits in this bigNumber.

      • shiftLeft

        void shiftLeft​(int numOfShifts)
        This method takes the number of shifts as an argument and shifts this number to the left by that number, which is simply multiplying this bigNumber by 10.
        Parameters:
        numOfShifts - no of digits to be shifted.

      • shiftRight

        void shiftRight​(int numOfShifts)
        This method takes the number of shifts as an argument and shifts this number to the right by that number, which is Simply dividing this bigNumber by 2.
        Parameters:
        numOfShifts - no of digits to be shifted.

      • addDigit

        void addDigit​(int digit)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method takes a single digit as an argument and adds it to this bigNumber.
        Parameters:
        digit - digit to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws an IllegalArgumentException if the digit passed to it is not a single non-negative digit.

      • getDigitAt

        int getDigitAt​(int index)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method that takes a position as an argument and returns the digit at that position from bigNumberList.
        Parameters:
        index - position of the digit in the bigNumber list.
        Returns:
        returns the digit at that index given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws an IllegalArgumentException if an invalid index is passed.

      • copy

        BigNumber copy()
        A functionality to get clone the given bingNumber.
        Returns:
        returns an identical and independent copy of this bigNumber.

      • add

        BigNumber add​(BigNumber other)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A functionality to add two BigNumbers and returns the sum of these two numbers.
        Parameters:
        other - second bigNumber to be added.
        Returns:
        returns the sum of these two bigNumbers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws IllegalArgumentException when second number is null.
